channel.title: math.KT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.KT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: The low dimensional homology groups of the elementary group of rank two
item.description: arXiv:2407.17632v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this article we study the first, the second and the third homology groups of the elementary group $\textrm{E}_2(A)$, where $A$ is a commutative ring. In particular, we prove a refined Bloch-Wigner type exact sequence over a semilocal ring (with some mild restriction on its residue fields) such that $-1\in (A^{\times})^2$ or $|A^{\times}/(A^{\times})^2|\leq 4$.
item.dc:creator: Behrooz Mirzaii, Elvis Torres P\'erez

item.title: The index of lattice Dirac operators and $K$-theory
item.description: arXiv:2407.17708v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We mathematically show an equality between the index of a Dirac operator on a flat continuum torus and the $\eta$ invariant of the Wilson Dirac operator with a negative mass when the lattice spacing is sufficiently small. Unlike the standard approach, our formulation using $K$-theory does not require the Ginsparg-Wilson relation or the modified chiral symmetry on the lattice. We prove that a one-parameter family of continuum massive Dirac operators and the corresponding Wilson Dirac operators belong to the same equivalence class of the $K^1$ group at a finite lattice spacing. Their indices, which are evaluated by the spectral flow or equivalently by the $\eta$ invariant at finite masses, are proved to be equal.
item.dc:creator: Shoto Aoki, Hidenori Fukaya, Mikio Furuta, Shinichiroh Matsuo, Tetsuya Onogi, Satoshi Yamaguchi

item.title: Enveloping operads and applications
item.description: arXiv:2407.18190v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: This work addresses the homotopical analysis of enveloping operads in a general cofibrantly generated symmetric monoidal model category. We show the potential of this analysis by obtaining, in a uniform way, several central results regarding the homotopy theory of operadic algebras.
item.dc:creator: Victor Carmona

item.title: On split Steinberg modules and Steinberg modules
item.description: arXiv:2407.18208v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Answering a question of Randal-Williams, we show the natural maps from split Steinberg modules of a Dedekind domain to the associated Steinberg modules are surjective.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Armeanu, Jeremy Miller
